name: Conquest and Conflict Quiz | History | 10 Questions

questions.text: Everyone knows that Francis Drake was a key participant in defeating the Spanish Armada. Other leaders were also involved, including this individual:
questions.explanation:
Martin Frobisher.

	He was also an explorer, a navigator, etc.

questions.text: We hear a lot about Civil War Generals, but not so much about those who fought the war at sea - such as this man:
questions.explanation:
David Farragut.

	'Mobile Bay' was a key victory.

questions.text: Everyone knows about the mistreatment of Montezuma by Cortez during the Spanish Conquest of the Aztecs in Mexico, but less is heard about similar treatment suffered by this Inca chief in Peru at the hands of Pizarro:
questions.explanation:
Atahualpa.

	Sadly with Spanish conquest, there were no happy endings for the Native Americans.

questions.text: William Tell is legendary as an opponent of tyranny. Who was the tyrant that he opposed?
questions.explanation:
Gessler.

	Gessler was the Habsburg governor. Whether Tell ever existed is doubted by historians but the legend lives on.

questions.text: Gallipoli was a key battle of World War I. In what part of the world was it fought?
questions.explanation:
Turkey.

	Thousands of Australians and New Zealanders were brutally shot down on the beach.

questions.text: The Charge of the Light Brigade is a celebrated event. In what battle of the Crimean War did it occur?
questions.explanation:
Balaklava.

	'Not though the soldiers knew someone had blundered'...

questions.text: Sam Houston avenged the Alamo with a victory at this battle:
questions.explanation:
San Jacinto.

	Santa Anna was the defeated General.

questions.text: This soldier was a key figure of the American Revolution in the Northwest Territory:
questions.explanation:
George Rogers Clark.

	He was the brother of William Clark of Lewis and Clark fame.

questions.text: Although Sitting Bull is most often associated with Custer's defeat at Little Bighorn, this Indian leader also played a key role:
questions.explanation:
Crazy Horse.

	This is probably the most famous Native American battle of all time.

questions.text: This individual won a key naval victory in the War of 1812, at the Battle of Lake Erie:
questions.explanation:
Oliver Perry.

	'We have met the enemy and he is ours ...'
